Installation and system requirements
The &SCSCP; package is designed for &GAP;4.5 and no compatibility with previous releases of &GAP;4 is guaranteed.
To use The &SCSCP; package it is necessary to install &GAP;4 packages &IO; , &GAPDoc; and (currently only development version of) &openmath; .
The &SCSCP; package is distributed in standard formats (tar.gz, tar.bz2, -win.zip) and can be obtained from http://www.cs.st-andrews.ac.uk/~alexk/scscp.htm, or http://www.symbolic-computation.org/, or the page http://www.gap-system.org/Packages/packages.html at the &GAP; web site. The latter also offers zoo-archive. To unpack the archive scscp-0.3.zoo you need the program unzoo, which can be obtained from the &GAP; homepage http://www.gap-system.org/ (see section `Distribution'). To install &SCSCP;, copy this archive into the pkg subdirectory of your &GAP;4.4 installation. The subdirectory scscp will be created in the pkg directory after the following command:
unzoo -x scscp-0.3.zoo
When you don't have access to the directory of your main &GAP; installation, you can also install the package outside the &GAP; main directory by unpacking it inside a directory MYGAPDIR/pkg. Then to be able to load &SCSCP; you need to call &GAP; with the -l ";MYGAPDIR" option.
Installation using other archive formats is performed in a similar way.
